intro: Althaea kragujevacensis, commonly known as the Kragujevac marshmallow, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes plants like hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its most distinctive feature is its woolly, mucilaginous capsules that contain numerous small seeds. Althaea kragujevacensis is often found in wet meadows and marshy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
